pros: Great place to work.  Fun Social Activities and  Really Good Management.

job_title: Prefer Not to Disclose in Toronto, ON
pros: A few experienced and caring front line staff!
cons: Listen! Even if they offer you a lucrative salary and position, walk away! They will overwhelm you with heavy load of work. They keep talking about inclusion and diversity. The management team does not care about the staff. They only think about their own benefits and promotions! They cheat a lot. They report false information to show the projects are on track, specially about the employment support for the clients. The CEO has a few pets who know how to make her happy. She only cares about them and if anyone complains they find a way to kick them out.

pros: Frontline staff care about their clients
cons: Unnecessarily toxic environment. CEO causes constant tensions, is disrespectful and the horrible culture lends to revolving doors. Worst staff retention I ever saw.

job_title: Prefer Not To Say in Toronto, ON
cons: Had a horrible experience before even starting to work there. My contract was suppose to start at a later date which I signed for and hr wanted me to start working at an earlier date than what the contract said, with no compassion over the fact I was finishing my last two weeks at another company. I got yelled at and gaslight by hr when I explained my situation to them and was told they do not care about my “personal” life which was actually part of my professional life. I did not even start working there yet and was shown that employees do not get any respect, which caused me to not take the position since the treatment I got was horrible… I saw their office today which reminded me of the treatment I received from them and I decided to leave a review for others to know what they are getting themselves into.

pros: Nice frontline staff, close to TTC
cons: Building in some serious need of repair and TLC Poor communication from top down Senior Managers don't care just their salary Senior Management style is to put you down, maybe to use the person as an example to others to stay in your lane High turnover Extremely low morale among staff Overall vibe is that the captain has abandoned the ship and they are sinking fast If you stay too long, you could be hurting your career path Board of Directors? Wonder if they really know the truth...

pros: The salary is higher than other agencies
cons: Constant turn-over of front-line staff and management making if very difficult to achieve goals as each manager makes changes for the sake of making changes and looking effective. Then that manager leaves in 6 months and we, front-line staff, go through the same process again.

They are in the business of inclusion but don't practice. Talk a lot about mental well being but do the opposite. The give part-time contracts but make you work full hours and expected you to be okay with no compensation. And yet they are in the business of employment and skilling and labour market.

review_title: One of the worst work places
pros: I dont think there was any positive aspect of working there, it's not even a good workplace to add in the resume.
cons:
There is a big gap between management and employees, the managers are not professional and do not care about the employees' professional development or satisfaction, they only continue hiring the ones that give them the team information. Also the level of services they provide is very low, everyone feels that they are wasting the government money and only care about preserving the management. 

Aside from that, their hiring is never transparent, they always hire people they know even if they do not relate to the position, as alot of employees do not have at least 10% of the relevant needed experience.

review_title: CEO DROWNING AND RUINING THE AGENCY
pros: The staff are truly amazing and are committed to providing the best services to immigrants and job seekers; given the the fact that they are often dealing with the highest turnover, a Tyrant and bully of a CEO who lies, and uses funds from various programs for her unrealistic vision that changes like her temperament. They work under very toxic environment but yet wear a smile daily serving families and communities. Truly amazing. Great for learning  depending on your career path or if you can stay clear of the CEO and her disciples
cons: You will be constantly overworked in a toxic environment with minimal pay and be told about funding cuts constantly or the lack but the CEO who is also the HR, the Board, Accounting..I mean a tyrant and a dictator who does selective hirng prying on newcomers who over qualify of the jobs they do and severally underpay, but the CEO behaves as if she is opening the golden door into your career. She will humiliate her supervisors in meetings. Her biggest fight is with the union leader whom she can never get rid off and if she could would do away with the Union. This is the only safety net for the frontline staff. She has zero knowledge of the programs and is laughable when she promotes her sidekick/friend who tries to fluff her way  when implementing the most stupid solutions for EO and other programs. This is sinking ship and im on my way out not even because I have another job offer, but this is a sinking ship!!

job_title: Employer Outreach Specialist in Toronto, ON
pros:
Family oriented atmosphere
Everyone is very employee and customer centric
cons: During my tenure, I noticed a sense of complacency had set in, especially in case of employees that had been working at the organization for several years. It looks like that is changing now, with new management.

review_title: sinking ship...staff strapping on own life vests

pros: Good reputation and people to work with...still...
cons: Top management syst(emat)ically damaging organization/staff well-being- more so higher you go.

pros: Friendly staff and great people to work with
cons: CEO runs the show at this organization... she has half baked ideas that do not work, humiliates staff in meetings and never approves anything unless there is vested interest and profit in it for her. She is the HR department !!!

pros: Casual environment, service spirit, great rapport across programs and locations. Deliver great services to the community, gives you a feeling of fulfillment.
cons: Silo mentality due to funding sources. Absolutely useless top management that led to unionizing.
